Package com.bfo.json

Interface JsonWriteOptions.Filter

Enclosing class:
JsonWriteOptions
public static interface JsonWriteOptions.Filter
A Filter which can be used to restrict which nodes are written, or to override the source of data for some nodes

  • Method Summary

    Method

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      default void initialize(Json context)
      Called once when the Json writing begins
      Parameters:
      context - the root node of the writing process

    • enter

      default Json enter(String key, Json child)
      Called before writing each entry in a Map, this method can control which entries from the map are written.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the current entry in the map
      child - the value of the current entry in the map
      Returns:
      child if the child is to be written, null if its not.

    • exit

      default void exit(String key, Json child)
      Called after writing each entry in a Map.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the current entry in the map
      child - the value of the current entry in the map

    • isProxy

      default boolean isProxy(Json json)
      Called before writing a node - if this method returns true, the proxyWrite(com.bfo.json.Json, java.io.OutputStream) method will be called with this node.
      Parameters:
      json - the object which we are about to write
      Returns:
      whether writing for this object should be proxied - default is false
      See Also:
      • proxyWrite(com.bfo.json.Json, java.io.OutputStream)

    • proxyWrite

      default void proxyWrite(Json json, OutputStream out) throws IOException

      If isProxy(com.bfo.json.Json) returned true for json, this method is called to write the specified object to the stream. This can be used to create JSON or CBOR objects from very large objects without needing them serialized in memory first. In both cases the object will be streamed directly to the OutputStream without any intermediate buffer.

      For example, if you have an object that you want to serialize to CBOR. Create a proxy object for it in the Json structure, then override this method to write it out. 

        Json json = ...;            // main Json object
  Json proxy = new Json(ByteBuffer.wrap(new byte[0]), null);
  json.put("file", proxy);    // put our proxy in the structure
  JsonWriteOptions options = new JsonWriteOptions().setFilter(new JsonWriteOptions.Filter() {
    public boolean isProxy(Json json) {
      return json == proxy;
    }
    public void proxyWrite(Json json, OutputStream out) throws IOException {
      widget.writeTo(out);      // Serialize our widget in place of the proxy.
    }
  });
 json.writeCbor(outputstream, options);
      Not every type of object can be proxied - currently it's just "buffer" type objects. The isProxy(com.bfo.json.Json) method will only be called if proxy writing is possible.
      Parameters:
      json - the object which we are supposed to be writing
      out - the OutputStream to write to.
      Throws:
      IOException - from the supplied OutputStream
